full_text: Plea FXiet kn keer eer Ele 2016/KER/65 IN THE HIGH COURT OF KERALA AT ERNAKULAM PRESENT: THE HONOURABLE MR. JUSTICE B.KEMAL PASHA MONDAY, THE 4TH DAY OF JANUARY 2016/14TH POUSHA, 1937 Cri.MC.No. 7847 of 2015 () SC.NO. 651/2014 OF DISTRICT AND SESSIONS COURT, KASARAGOD CRIME NO. 564/2013 OF ADHUR POLICE STATION , KASARGOD DISTRICT PETITIONER(S)/ACCUSED: 1. K.S.MUHAMMED ASHIQUE THANGAL B.A., AGED 20 YEARS, S/O.KOYAKUNHI THANGAL, ASHIQUE MANZIL, POVVAL, BENCH COURT, MULIYAR VILLAGE & POST, KASARAGOD. 2. MUHAMMED THAISEER.A., AGED 21 YEARS, S/O.ABDULLA, POVVAL KOTTAHOUSE, POVVAL, MULIYAR VILLAGE & POST, KASARAGOD. 3. M.LABOOBAKER AJAS, AGED 20 YEARS, S/O.MUHAMMED, SIYAZ MANZIL, KETTUMKALLU, CHERKALA, CHENGALA, VILLAGE & POST, KASARAGOD BY ADV. SRI.S.JIJI RESPONDENT(S)/DEFACTO COMPLAINANT & STATE: 1. STATE OF KERALA, REPRESENTED BY PUBLIC PROSECUTOR, HIGH COURT OF KERALA, ERNAKULAM. 2. JIJU MURALI, S/O.MURALI, AGED 19 YEARS, CHAYITHALA HOUSE, KARADUKKA POST & VILLAGE, KARADUKKA, KASARAGOD. PIN-671 125 R1 BY PUBLIC PROSECUTOR SMT. MAYA R2 BY ADV. SMT.K.S.SANTHI THIS CRIMINAL MISC. CASE HAVING COME UP FOR ADMISSION ON 04-01-2016, THE COURT ON THE SAME DAY PASSED THE FOLLOWING: sts Pleas El FR eit eer Ele 2016/KER/65 Cri.MC.No. 7847 of 2015 () APPENDIX PETITIONER(S)' ANNEXURES: ANNEX A1: CERTIFIED COPY OF FINAL REPORT IN CR.564/2013 OF ADHUR POLICE STATION ANNEX A2: AFFIDAVIT DATED 25.11.2015 SWON BY THE 2ND RESPONDENT RESPONDENT(S) ANNEXURES: NIL ITRUE COPY/ P.S.TO JUDGE sts 2016/KER/65 seas Oe REMAL PASHA Scores Dated this the 4" day of January, 2016 ORDER Petitioners are the accused in SC No. 651/2014 of the District and Sessions Court, Kasaragod, which has arisen from Crime No.564/2013 of the Adhur Police Station, for the offences punishable under Sections 341, 323 and 506(i) read with Section 34 IPC. 2. The matter has been amicably settled between the petitioners and the defacto complainant, who is the 2 respondent herein. The defacto complainant has _ filed Annexure-A2 affidavit affirming that the matter has been amicably settled between him and the petitioners, and he has no complaints against the petitioners. 3. No criminal antecedents have been reported against the petitioners. When the matter has been amicably settled, no purpose would be served in proceeding with the 2016/KER/65 matter further, and therefore, Annexure- A711 final report and all further proceedings against the petitioners in SC No. 651/2014 of the District and Sessions Court, Kasaragod, which has arisen from Crime No.564/2013 of the Adhur Police Station, can be quashed. In the result, this Crl.M.C. is allowed and Annexure- A1 final report and all further proceedings against the petitioners in SC No. 651/2014 of the District and Sessions Court, Kasaragod, which has arisen from Crime No.564/2013 of the Adhur Police Station, are hereby quashed. Sd/- B.KEMAL PASHA, JUDGE. Stu/04.01.2016. [True copy] P.S. to Judge
